metadata.title: CVE-2022-0097 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
Inappropriate implementation in DevTools in Google Chrome prior to97.0.4692.71 allowed an attacker who convinced a user to install amalicious extension to to potentially allow extension to escape the sandboxvia a crafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-0097` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 97.0.4692.71-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 97.0.4692.71-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 97.0.4692.71-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 97.0.4692.71-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 97.0.4692.71-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '97.0.4692.71-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
